hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Weekend Reversal Edge
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, a significant price drop (>3%) on the Friday before a major US holiday weekend (e.g., Christmas, Thanksgiving) followed by low weekend volume (<30% of 20-day avg) presents a high-probability mean reversion opportunity, with a bounce expected by the following Tuesday's market open.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday-induced selling pressure from ETFs/traders reducing weekend risk exposure creates exaggerated moves. The subsequent liquidity vacuum and lack of follow-through selling over the weekend, combined with a return of institutional bids post-holiday, often leads to a reversal. Current news mentions a 'holiday lull' and ETF outflows, setting up this dynamic.
entry_conditions: BTC 1D close down >3% on Friday before major US holiday
Weekend (Sat-Sun) aggregate spot volume <30% of 20-day average
Enter long on Sunday 22:00 UTC at the weekend's volume-weighted average price (VWAP)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If more than 60% of such signals over a 2-year backtest fail to reach the 5% TP before hitting the 2% SL, or if the average return is negative.
